Sentence1: AUSTIN, Texas, March 07, 2023--(BUSINESS WIRE)--CrowdStrike Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq: CRWD), a global cybersecurity leader that provides cloud-delivered protection of endpoints, cloud workloads, identity and data, today announced financial results for the fourth quarter and fiscal year 2023, ended January 31, 2023.
Sentence2: AUSTIN, Texas, March 07, 2023--(BUSINESS WIRE)--CrowdStrike Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq: CRWD), a global cybersecurity leader that provides cloud-delivered protection of endpoints, cloud workloads, identity and data, today announced financial results for the fourth quarter and fiscal year 2023, ended January 31, 2023.

Sentence2: Fourth Quarter Fiscal 2023 Financial Highlights.

Sentence2: Subscription revenue is $598.3 million.

Sentence1: Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) increased 48% year-over-year and grew to $2.56 billion as of January 31, 2023, of which $221.7 million was net new ARR added in the quarter.
Sentence2: Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) is $2.56 billion and net new ARR is $221.7 million .

Sentence1: Restructuring Plan:.
Sentence2: Restructuring Plan:.

Sentence1: On January 27, 2023, the Board of Directors of the Company approved a restructuring plan to adjust its cost structure and accelerate its timeline to achieve greater than 20% free cash flow margins.
Sentence2: On January 27, 2023, the Board of Directors of the Company approved a restructuring plan to adjust its cost structure and accelerate its timeline to achieve greater than 20% free cash flow margins.

Sentence1: The Restructuring Plan includes both the elimination of positions across the Company as well as the shifting of additional positions across a broader geographical footprint over the next several months.
Sentence2: The Restructuring Plan includes both the elimination of positions across the Company as well as the shifting of additional positions across a broader geographical footprint over the next several months.

Sentence1: As a result of these headcount actions, the Company’s total employee base will be reduced by approximately 11%.
Sentence2: As a result of these headcount actions, the Company’s total employee base will be reduced by approximately 11%.

Sentence1: The Company estimates it will incur approximately $25 to $27 million in non-recurring charges in connection with the Restructuring Plan, predominantly related to cash expenditures for employee transition and severance payments, employee benefits, and stock-based compensation.
Sentence2: The Company estimates it will incur approximately $25 to $27 million in non-recurring charges in connection with the Restructuring Plan, predominantly related to cash expenditures for employee transition and severance payments, employee benefits, and stock-based compensation.

Sentence1: The restructuring will result in an annualized run-rate savings of $60 million.
Sentence2: The restructuring will result in an annualized run-rate savings of $60 million.

Sentence1: The Company expects most charges to be recognized by June 30, 2023.
Sentence2: The Company expects most charges to be recognized by June 30, 2023.

Sentence1: The costs associated with the Restructuring Plan will be included in the Company’s GAAP results and will be excluded from the Company’s non-GAAP results, including Adjusted EBITDA and free cash flow.
Sentence2: The costs associated with the Restructuring Plan will be included in the Company’s GAAP results and will be excluded from the Company’s non-GAAP results, including Adjusted EBITDA and free cash flow.

Sentence1: Share Repurchase Expansion:.
Sentence2: Share Repurchase Expansion:.

Sentence1: On February 14, 2023, the Board of Directors approved an expansion of the Company’s share repurchase program designed to maximize value for DigitalOcean investors.
Sentence2: On February 14, 2023, the Board of Directors approved an expansion of the Company’s share repurchase program designed to maximize value for DigitalOcean investors.

Sentence1: The approval authorizes the Company to repurchase up to $500 million of stock during 2023, following the repurchase of $600 million of stock in 2022.
Sentence2: The approval authorizes the Company to repurchase up to $500 million of stock during 2023, following the repurchase of $600 million of stock in 2022.

Sentence1: Of the $500 million authorization, the Company is committed to purchasing at least $230 million in 2023 and may opportunistically purchase up to an additional $270 million during 2023.
Sentence2: Of the $500 million authorization, the Company is committed to purchasing at least $230 million in 2023 and may opportunistically purchase up to an additional $270 million during 2023.

Sentence1: It is also the Company’s current expectation that in 2024 it will repurchase up to 125% of the free cash flow generated in that year.
Sentence2: It is also the Company’s current expectation that in 2024 it will repurchase up to 125% of the free cash flow generated in that year.

Sentence1: Recent Business Highlights.
Sentence2: Recent Business Highlights.

Sentence1: Launched industry-first Security Service Edge (SSE) innovations to protect enterprises from the most sophisticated cyberattacks.
Sentence2: Launched industry-first Security Service Edge (SSE) innovations to protect enterprises from the most sophisticated cyberattacks.

Sentence1: Delivered as part of the Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange, these innovations establish a new standard for ZTNA to minimize the attack surface, while stopping threats with private app protection, integrated deception, and privileged remote access capabilities for business and OT systems.
Sentence2: Delivered as part of the Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange, these innovations establish a new standard for ZTNA to minimize the attack surface, while stopping threats with private app protection, integrated deception, and privileged remote access capabilities for business and OT systems.

Sentence1: Released annual Zscaler ThreatLabZ research revealing up to a 400% increase in Phishing-as-a-Service as the key source of attacks across critical industries and consumers globally, underscoring the urgency for businesses and users to adopt a Zero Trust security model.
Sentence2: Released annual Zscaler ThreatLabZ research revealing up to a 400% increase in Phishing-as-a-Service as the key source of attacks across critical industries and consumers globally, underscoring the urgency for businesses and users to adopt a Zero Trust security model.

Sentence1: Invested in Zscaler’s hypergrowth strategy with the appointment of Brendan Castle, Chief People Officer.
Sentence2: Invested in Zscaler’s hypergrowth strategy with the appointment of Brendan Castle, Chief People Officer.

Sentence1: Bringing 30 years of experience from organizations like Google and Citibank, Castle will lead the expansion of Zscaler's global People and Culture organization, including talent acquisition, learning and development, internal business partners, diversity, equity and inclusion, and our workplace experience.
Sentence2: Bringing 30 years of experience from organizations like Google and Citibank, Castle will lead the expansion of Zscaler's global People and Culture organization, including talent acquisition, learning and development, internal business partners, diversity, equity and inclusion, and our workplace experience.

Sentence1: As a founding member of the Cloud Security Alliance (CSA), Zscaler, along with alliance partners CrowdStrike and Okta, announced the formation of the Zero Trust Advancement Center to bring together existing research and education projects at CSA that will be disseminated online and through its global network chapters.
Sentence2: As a founding member of the Cloud Security Alliance (CSA), Zscaler, along with alliance partners CrowdStrike and Okta, announced the formation of the Zero Trust Advancement Center to bring together existing research and education projects at CSA that will be disseminated online and through its global network chapters.

Sentence2: Released annual State of Encrypted Attacks Report, which details the analysis of more than 24 billion threats to track trends of HTTPS-based attacks.

Sentence1: Reinforced commitment to improving the nation’s cyber resiliency by joining the Joint Cyber Defense Collaborative (JCDC).
Sentence2: Reinforced commitment to improving the nation’s cyber resiliency by joining the Joint Cyber Defense Collaborative (JCDC).

Sentence2: The JCDC leads the development and implementation of joint cyber defense plans and operations through critical partnerships with the private sector, Federal government and state, local, tribal and territorial governments.

Sentence1: Introduced Zscaler Resilience™, the industry’s first cloud resilience for SSE to ensure nonstop cloud security operations.
Sentence2: Introduced Zscaler Resilience™, the industry’s first cloud resilience for SSE to ensure nonstop cloud security operations.

Sentence1: New capabilities extend the resilience of Zscaler’s architecture and maintain interconnections with critical cloud-based applications for customers to prepare for and quickly recover from black swan events that could otherwise disrupt or stop business operations.
Sentence2: New capabilities extend the resilience of Zscaler’s architecture and maintain interconnections with critical cloud-based applications for customers to prepare for and quickly recover from black swan events that could otherwise disrupt or stop business operations.

Sentence2: Acquired Canonic Security™ in February 2023, a SaaS application security platform innovator.

Sentence1: Canonic’s platform is designed to prevent organizations' growing risks of SaaS supply chain attacks.
Sentence2: Canonic’s platform is designed to prevent organizations' growing risks of SaaS supply chain attacks.

Sentence2: These new capabilities further expand the Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange™ data protection set of services enabling enterprises to protect data being accessed through third-party applications and integrations.

Sentence1: Effective August 1, 2022, the beginning of our fiscal year ending July 31, 2023, we adopted Accounting Standards Update No.
Sentence2: Effective August 1, 2022, the beginning of our fiscal year ending July 31, 2023, we adopted Accounting Standards Update No.

Sentence1: 2020-06, Debt with Conversion and Other Options (Subtopic 470-20) and Derivatives and Hedging - Contracts in Entity’s Own Equity (Subtopic 815-40) (ASU 2020-06), using the modified retrospective transition method.
Sentence2: 2020-06, Debt with Conversion and Other Options (Subtopic 470-20) and Derivatives and Hedging - Contracts in Entity’s Own Equity (Subtopic 815-40) (ASU 2020-06), using the modified retrospective transition method.

Sentence1: The adoption of this standard resulted in the elimination of the debt discount and related amortization as interest expense and the classification of the portion of the debt issuance costs initially allocated to equity within the carrying amount of our senior convertible notes, which will be amortized as interest expense.
Sentence2: The adoption of this standard resulted in the elimination of the debt discount and related amortization as interest expense and the classification of the portion of the debt issuance costs initially allocated to equity within the carrying amount of our senior convertible notes, which will be amortized as interest expense.

Sentence1: Additionally, ASU 2020-06 amended the calculation of diluted earnings per share for certain convertible debt instruments, eliminating the treasury stock method and requiring the use of the if-converted method to compute the underlying potentially diluted shares.
Sentence2: Additionally, ASU 2020-06 amended the calculation of diluted earnings per share for certain convertible debt instruments, eliminating the treasury stock method and requiring the use of the if-converted method to compute the underlying potentially diluted shares.

Sentence2: Accordingly, to account for the potentially diluted shares related to our senior convertible notes, we are required to add back the non-GAAP interest expense to our non-GAAP net income and include approximately 7.63 million shares related to our senior convertible notes beginning in our first quarter of fiscal year 2023.
